{{disambig-two|the Quenya word and the tengwa|Ring of Power|[[Vilya]]}}
'''''vilya''''' or '''''wilya''''' is a [[Quenya]] word meaning "air, sky".<ref name="Names">{{App|Letters}}, Note, ''The names of the letters''</ref>
==Example==
* ''[[Nieninquë|yan i '''wilyar''' antar miquelis]]'' = "to whom the air gives kisses"

==Tengwa==
[[Image:Vilya.gif|left]]''Vilya'' is also the name for the twenty-fourth letter of the [[Tengwar]] alphabet.<ref name="Names"/>  It is the fourth letter of the sixth grade or [[Tyellë]], which contains "semi-vocalic" consonants and it is the sixth letter in the fourth series of consonants.<ref>{{App|Letters}}</ref>  In early written Quenya this letter represented '''W''' when the letter was called ''Wilya''.  Over time this letter ceased to have a clear function.  However, in the [[Mode of Beleriand]] (as seen in the [[Doors of Durin|West-gate]] of [[Moria]] inscription) ''Vilya'' is used for a following '''W''' in the diphthong ''iw''.<ref>{{FR|II4}}</ref>  The [[Westron]] name for this letter is ''''''Á'''''.<ref>See ''[[Alphabet of Fëanor: Numenian, or Westron, Mode]]''</ref>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In earlier [[Qenya]], the word was ''wilma'' ("inner or lower air") and comes from the [[Sundocarme|root]] [[WIL]].<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, WIL-</ref>

In the earlier ''[[Ambarkanta]]'', there are different terms for the air of the atmosphere ([[Vista]]) and the sky ([[Ilmen]]).
